intro: Oligactis garcia-barrigae, commonly known as the Garcia-Barriga's oligactis, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically exhibit a combination of white and green hues. Native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of dense forests. Its botanical features include narrow, strap-like leaves and a unique floral structure that facilitates pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oligactis garcia-barrigae is considered a conservation concern.
